subject: RE: [junit] testing interfaces
msgSnippet: Sebastian Menge wrote: Hi all! ... Sebastian, If the interface represents a contract of sorts, you should probably write a common test case, and re-use it in
messageBody:
Sebastian Menge wrote:
Hi all!
> I have 2 interfaces "DocumentPool" and "Document" and multiple
> implementions of these (like HTMLPool, WordDocPool). The target is to
> link these (about 50.000) docs using different "rules".
>
> should i write my unit tests for each implementation or could i save
> time by writing one testcase to test the interface?

Sebastian,

If the interface represents a contract of sorts, you should probably write a
common test case, and re-use it in the test cases for the concrete classes.

If the interface simply represents an abstraction of methods, with no real
common behaviour between them (like, say, a Command pattern), then I
wouldn't bother.

Robert.
